articles.description: Follow live text and radio commentary as Wolves host Burnley and Arsenal visit Luton in the Premier League.
articles.title: Premier League: Wolves face Burnley & Arsenal visit Luton - build-up

articles.description: Watch BBC One coverage and follow live text as Scotland host England in the Women's Nations League.
articles.title: Women's Nations League: Scotland v England - watch, listen & follow text

articles.description: Live video and text coverage of Northern Ireland against the Republic of Ireland in the Women's Nations League from the National Stadium at Windsor Park.
articles.title: Watch: Build-up to Northern Ireland v Republic of Ireland

articles.description: Watch on Match of the Day Wales and listen to BBC Radio Wales and BBC Radio Cymru commentary as Wales host Germany in the Women's Nations League in Swansea.
articles.title: Watch: Women's Nations League - Wales v Germany

articles.description: The ball that will be used at Euro 2024 in Germany will lead to quicker, more accurate decisions by the video assistant referee, says Uefa.
articles.title: Euro 2024 ball will mean faster VAR decisions - Uefa

articles.description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp says Trent Alexander-Arnold will play "wherever it's best for us" after scoring a late winner from midfield against Fulham.
articles.title: Alexander-Arnold will play 'wherever it's best'

articles.description: New Sheffield United manager Chris Wilder says his relationship with owner Prince Abdullah was "repaired a long time ago" as he returns following the sacking of Paul Heckingbottom.
articles.title: Owner relationship repaired long time ago - Wilder

articles.description: Paul Heckingbottom is sacked as Sheffield United manager and replaced by the club's former boss Chris Wilder.
articles.title: Sheff Utd sack Heckingbottom and appoint Wilder

articles.description: The continuing speculation around Jon Rahm joining LIV Golf is a worrying time for the established tours, writes Iain Carter.
articles.title: 'Rahm signing would arguably be LIV's biggest coup'

articles.description: Manchester United ban journalists from four media outlets from a news conference with manager Erik ten Hag.
articles.title: Man Utd ban journalists from news conference
